name: decode-behavior-from-neural-trajectories
title: Decode Behavior from Neural Trajectories
description: Model neural activity trajectories and decode behavioral variables using PCA and Kalman filtering
content:
Overview

This application models neural activity trajectories and decodes behavioral variables. Built using Biomni, it uses PCA for dimensionality reduction and Kalman filtering to predict behavior from neural data.

Features

  • Dimensionality reduction using Principal Component Analysis
  • Kalman filter-based behavioral decoding
  • Train/test split for model validation
  • Mean squared error performance metrics
  • Visualization of decoded trajectories

Parameters

  • Neural Data File: CSV file with neural spiking activity (rows=timepoints, cols=neurons)
  • Behavioral Data File: CSV file with behavioral variables (rows=timepoints, cols=variables)
  • N Components: Number of PCA components for dimensionality reduction
  • Output Directory: Select or create a stash folder for output

Output

The application generates PNG plots of explained variance and decoded trajectories, CSV sample results, and a pickle file with full results.

Use Cases

  • Brain-computer interfaces
  • Neural prosthetics development
  • Understanding neural coding
  • Predicting movement from neural signals
command: rm -rf prod_apps 2>/dev/null || true && git clone https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git prod_apps && python "prod_apps/biomni/bioengineering/decode_behavior_from_neural_trajectories.py" "${neuralDataFile}" "${behavioralDataFile}" --n-components ${nComponents} -o "${outputDir}"
